clusters.title: Should we really all be taking magnesium supplements? – podcast
clusters.neutral_headline: Should we really all be taking magnesium supplements? – podcast
bullet_summary: They also hear from Katherine Tucker, the founder of the Center for Population Health at the University of Massachusetts Lowell

items.title: Should we really all be taking magnesium supplements? – podcast
items.standfirst: Testimonials about the beneficial health effects of magnesium supplements abound online, with influencers claiming that a daily pill can help with everything from anxiety to sleep and brain fog. But do any of these claims stack up?Ian Sample is joined by co-host Madeleine Finlay to find out where the science stands. They also hear from Katherine Tucker, the founder of the Center for Population Health at the University of Massachusetts Lowell. She explains what magnesium is doing in our bodies and the best approach we can take to ensure we are getting enoughSupport the Guardian: theguardian.com/sciencepod Continue reading...
items.content: Testimonials about the beneficial health effects of magnesium supplements abound online, with influencers claiming that a daily pill can help with everything from anxiety to sleep and brain fog. But do any of these claims stack up?Ian Sample is joined by co-host Madeleine Finlay to find out where the science stands. They also hear from Katherine Tucker, the founder of the Center for Population Health at the University of Massachusetts Lowell. She explains what magnesium is doing in our bodies and the best approach we can take to ensure we are getting enoughSupport the Guardian: theguardian.com/sciencepod Continue reading...

clusters.title: NHS ’clearly failing’ to ensure children get measles vaccine, experts warn
clusters.neutral_headline: NHS ’clearly failing’ to ensure children get measles vaccine, experts warn

items.title: NHS ’clearly failing’ to ensure children get measles vaccine, experts warn
items.standfirst: Calls grow for reform of England’s vaccination system including delivery of jabs in pharmacies as take-up fallsChildren are at risk of measles because the NHS is “clearly failing” to ensure they get the MMR vaccine and its system needs an urgent overhaul, MPs and health experts have warned.Calls are growing for major reform of how MMR jabs are delivered as it emerged that vaccination rates in some parts of England are now on a par with those in Afghanistan and Malawi. Continue reading...
items.content: Calls grow for reform of England’s vaccination system including delivery of jabs in pharmacies as take-up fallsChildren are at risk of measles because the NHS is “clearly failing” to ensure they get the MMR vaccine and its system needs an urgent overhaul, MPs and health experts have warned.Calls are growing for major reform of how MMR jabs are delivered as it emerged that vaccination rates in some parts of England are now on a par with those in Afghanistan and Malawi. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Fertility patients win high court battle to save embryos after consent error
clusters.neutral_headline: Fertility patients win high court battle to save embryos after consent error
bullet_summary: Ruling that the material could be kept, the judge said they should not “have the possibility of parenthood … removed by the ticking of a clock”

items.title: Fertility patients win high court battle to save embryos after consent error
items.standfirst: Judge says people should not lose chance of parenthood ‘by the ticking of a clock’ after 10-year deadline missedMore than a dozen fertility patients have won a high court battle to save their embryos, eggs and sperm from destruction after errors meant they did not renew consent to store them within the 10-year window required by law.Ruling that the material could be kept, the judge said they should not “have the possibility of parenthood … removed by the ticking of a clock”. Continue reading...
items.content: Judge says people should not lose chance of parenthood ‘by the ticking of a clock’ after 10-year deadline missedMore than a dozen fertility patients have won a high court battle to save their embryos, eggs and sperm from destruction after errors meant they did not renew consent to store them within the 10-year window required by law.Ruling that the material could be kept, the judge said they should not “have the possibility of parenthood … removed by the ticking of a clock”. Continue reading...

clusters.title: ‘A lot of vaccine hesitancy’: how north London council is responding to measles outbreak
clusters.neutral_headline: ‘A lot of vaccine hesitancy’: how north London council...

items.title: ‘A lot of vaccine hesitancy’: how north London council is responding to measles outbreak
items.standfirst: Health professionals are having to find innovative ways to reach parents whose children have not had the MMR jabMore than 60 children infected in north London measles outbreakFor people living and working in Enfield, the current measles outbreak is a shock – but not a surprise. The borough has struggled with low vaccine uptake for years, fighting against vaccine hesitancy, online misinformation and health inequalities.Working closely with communities to persuade them to come forward for vaccinations is an “ongoing public health challenge”, which Enfield – like many boroughs – is grappling with, said Enfield council’s director of public health, Dudu Sher-Arami. Continue reading...
items.content: Health professionals are having to find innovative ways to reach parents whose children have not had the MMR jabMore than 60 children infected in north London measles outbreakFor people living and working in Enfield, the current measles outbreak is a shock – but not a surprise. The borough has struggled with low vaccine uptake for years, fighting against vaccine hesitancy, online misinformation and health inequalities.Working closely with communities to persuade them to come forward for vaccinations is an “ongoing public health challenge”, which Enfield – like many boroughs – is grappling with, said Enfield council’s director of public health, Dudu Sher-Arami. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Single dose of potent psychedelic drug could help treat depression, trial shows
clusters.neutral_headline: Single dose of potent psychedelic drug could help treat depression, trial shows

items.title: Single dose of potent psychedelic drug could help treat depression, trial shows
items.standfirst: Researchers find DMT – used in shamanic rituals – in tandem with psychotherapy has significant effect People with major depressive disorder can see a rapid and lasting improvement after a single dose of the psychedelic drug dimethyltryptamine (DMT) when it is combined with psychotherapy, doctors have said.A small clinical trial involving 34 people found that psychedelic-assisted therapy prompted a swift reduction in depressive symptoms that endured long after the drug had worn off, with some still feeling the benefits six months later. Continue reading...
items.content: Researchers find DMT – used in shamanic rituals – in tandem with psychotherapy has significant effect People with major depressive disorder can see a rapid and lasting improvement after a single dose of the psychedelic drug dimethyltryptamine (DMT) when it is combined with psychotherapy, doctors have said.A small clinical trial involving 34 people found that psychedelic-assisted therapy prompted a swift reduction in depressive symptoms that endured long after the drug had worn off, with some still feeling the benefits six months later. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Measles: how does it spread and how can I protect my child?
clusters.neutral_headline: Fast-spreading measles outbreak takes hold among under-10s in north London
bullet_summary: UKHSA previously reported 34 laboratory-confirmed measles cases among children who attend schools and nurseries in Enfield from 1 January to 9 February, with some requiring hospital treatment

items.title: Measles: how does it spread and how can I protect my child?
items.standfirst: A measles outbreak among unvaccinated children in London comes amid a global increase in infectionsA measles outbreak in London is affecting unvaccinated children under the age of 10, and comes amid an increase in infections globally.The UK was among six countries to lose the measles-free status granted by the World Health Organization (WHO) last month. Experts are calling on governments to urgently boost vaccination rates to stop measles infecting more children. Continue reading...
items.content: A measles outbreak among unvaccinated children in London comes amid a global increase in infectionsA measles outbreak in London is affecting unvaccinated children under the age of 10, and comes amid an increase in infections globally.The UK was among six countries to lose the measles-free status granted by the World Health Organization (WHO) last month. Experts are calling on governments to urgently boost vaccination rates to stop measles infecting more children. Continue reading...

items.title: Fast-spreading measles outbreak takes hold among under-10s in north London
items.standfirst: UK Health Security Agency urges parents in Enfield to get their children vaccinated as Easter holiday travels approach‘We almost lost you in the night’ - the life-threatening rise of measlesA big measles outbreak in north-east London is affecting unvaccinated children under the age of 10, the UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) has confirmed.UKHSA previously reported 34 laboratory-confirmed measles cases among children who attend schools and nurseries in Enfield from 1 January to 9 February, with some requiring hospital treatment. Continue reading...
items.content: UK Health Security Agency urges parents in Enfield to get their children vaccinated as Easter holiday travels approach‘We almost lost you in the night’ - the life-threatening rise of measlesA big measles outbreak in north-east London is affecting unvaccinated children under the age of 10, the UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) has confirmed.UKHSA previously reported 34 laboratory-confirmed measles cases among children who attend schools and nurseries in Enfield from 1 January to 9 February, with some requiring hospital treatment. Continue reading...

clusters.title: I was told my inability to conceive a second child was a ‘mystery’. In fact, I was simply ignored | Katie Found
clusters.neutral_headline: I was told my inability to conceive a second child was a ‘mystery’. In fact,...
bullet_summary: ”The fertility specialist said it lightly, almost kindly, from behind his desk

items.title: I was told my inability to conceive a second child was a ‘mystery’. In fact, I was simply ignored | Katie Found
items.standfirst: Women’s pain is routinely minimised, normalised, or psychologised. In fertility medicine, this dismissal is compounded by an industry structured around efficiency rather than care“The female body is such a mystery.”The fertility specialist said it lightly, almost kindly, from behind his desk. I was there because my partner and I had been trying for a second child without success. At the time, our son was two. We had conceived him naturally and relatively quickly, so after months of negative pregnancy tests I knew that something was off. Continue reading...
items.content: Women’s pain is routinely minimised, normalised, or psychologised. In fertility medicine, this dismissal is compounded by an industry structured around efficiency rather than care“The female body is such a mystery.”The fertility specialist said it lightly, almost kindly, from behind his desk. I was there because my partner and I had been trying for a second child without success. At the time, our son was two. We had conceived him naturally and relatively quickly, so after months of negative pregnancy tests I knew that something was off. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Fertility treatment given special emphasis as Trump Rx site goes live
clusters.neutral_headline: Fertility treatment given special emphasis as Trump Rx site goes live
bullet_summary: “We’ve been hearing about TrumpRx for a long time,” said Dr Richard Paulson, a professor of reproductive medicine at the University of Southern California

items.title: Fertility treatment given special emphasis as Trump Rx site goes live
items.standfirst: Experts say discounts on IVF procedures an attempt to fulfil campaign promise but savings only a fraction of total cost TrumpRx, the US president’s much-anticipated drug discount program, went live earlier this month with coupons available for just 43 medications, including four required for in vitro fertilization (IVF) procedures, and experts say this is probably a half-measure to fulfill Trump’s 2024 campaign promise to make IVF treatment universally accessible.“We’ve been hearing about TrumpRx for a long time,” said Dr Richard Paulson, a professor of reproductive medicine at the University of Southern California. “TrumpRx was supposed to fix all of the problems in terms of prescription drug costs and so on, and it has not done that. The only two classes of drugs that are actually cheaper on Trump RX are the GLP-1 agonists – those are the obesity medications – and fertility drugs.” Continue reading...
items.content: Experts say discounts on IVF procedures an attempt to fulfil campaign promise but savings only a fraction of total cost TrumpRx, the US president’s much-anticipated drug discount program, went live earlier this month with coupons available for just 43 medications, including four required for in vitro fertilization (IVF) procedures, and experts say this is probably a half-measure to fulfill Trump’s 2024 campaign promise to make IVF treatment universally accessible.“We’ve been hearing about TrumpRx for a long time,” said Dr Richard Paulson, a professor of reproductive medicine at the University of Southern California. “TrumpRx was supposed to fix all of the problems in terms of prescription drug costs and so on, and it has not done that. The only two classes of drugs that are actually cheaper on Trump RX are the GLP-1 agonists – those are the obesity medications – and fertility drugs.” Continue reading...
